story: On December 9, 1531, Juan Diego encountered a beautiful woman surrounded by light on Tepeyac Hill. She spoke in his native Nahuatl language and asked him to tell the bishop to build a church there. The bishop demanded a sign. On December 12, Mary told Juan Diego to gather roses from the hilltop (impossible in winter) and present them to the bishop. When Juan Diego opened his tilma before the bishop, dozens of Castilian roses fell out and the miraculous image of Our Lady appeared imprinted on the fabric.

During the 9th apparition on February 25, Mary told Bernadette to 'drink at the spring and wash in it.' When Bernadette dug in the mud, a spring emerged that now produces 27,000 gallons daily. During the 16th apparition on March 25, when Bernadette asked Mary's name three times, she replied in local dialect: 'I am the Immaculate Conception.'

On October 13, before 70,000 witnesses including atheists and journalists, the sun appeared to dance, spin, and plunge toward earth, drying rain-soaked ground instantly. Newspapers worldwide reported the solar phenomenon.

They saw Mary crowned and praying, St. Joseph, St. John the Evangelist holding a book, and a lamb on an altar with a cross behind it - representing the Mass. The ground remained completely dry where the apparition appeared despite torrential rain. No words were spoken, but the vision conveyed the centrality of the Eucharist.

The tears were televised on Japanese national TV and scientifically verified as human tears. Stigmata wounds appeared on the statue's right hand matching wounds that appeared on Sister Agnes's hand. Bishop Ito declared the events supernatural after 8-year investigation.

As villagers prayed the rosary, messages appeared in golden letters: 'Pray my children, God will hear you soon' and 'My Son allows Himself to be moved.' That same night, the advancing Prussian army stopped 30 miles from Pontmain. The armistice was signed 11 days later, and all 38 Pontmain soldiers returned home alive.

Despite skepticism and medical/psychological examinations, the five children never changed their testimony.

The apparitions transformed the Beco family - even Mariette's skeptical father converted. The spring has since been associated with healings.

In 1994, 800,000 Tutsis were killed including visionary Marie-Claire who was martyred. The apparitions are the only Vatican-approved apparitions in Africa.

The site became a pilgrimage destination and has survived war and destruction - the church has been rebuilt five times.

Casting again, they caught the head. Immediately their nets filled with so many fish they nearly sank the boat. The small statue, only 15 inches tall, was enshrined. Miracles multiplied, and today the National Shrine receives 12 million pilgrims yearly - making it the second most-visited Marian shrine worldwide.

Scientific analysis confirmed the image penetrates the rock rather than being painted on it. The spectacular Gothic basilica now spans the gorge over the miraculous image.

Walsingham became England's greatest pilgrimage site for 500 years until Henry VIII destroyed it in 1538. It was restored in 1897 and is now the Catholic National Shrine.

This is unique as the only apparition occurring while Mary lived on earth. During the 1936 Spanish Civil War, three bombs hit the basilica but miraculously failed to explode.

She described how faith would be lost, sacraments abandoned, and priests would fall away. Mary promised that devotion to the Eucharist and her Immaculate Heart would restore the Church. The statue's face was miraculously formed during prayer, and it has opened its eyes multiple times before witnesses.

She revealed a healing spring and gave Bernardo stigmata wounds. Despite the civil war, the bishop approved the apparitions in just two years - one of the fastest approvals in modern Church history.

Mary prophesied the Second Vatican Council years before it was announced and gave detailed messages about Church unity. After a thorough 43-year investigation, Bishop Punt approved the apparitions in 2002. The prayer Mary taught is now prayed in over 90 countries.

For the next three years, Mary appeared hundreds of times on and around the church, witnessed by millions including Coptic Pope Kyrillos VI, President Nasser's wife, and countless Muslims. Egyptian TV filmed the apparitions. Mary never spoke, but her presence brought Christians and Muslims together in prayer. Documented healings occurred, and luminous doves appeared with no natural explanation.

Despite initial communist persecution and later war, Medjugorje has become one of Christianity's most visited sites with 40+ million pilgrims. The Vatican permits organized pilgrimages while investigation continues. Dramatic conversions and documented healings number in the thousands.
